docs.summary: An object containing ticketing functionality.
description: Use the Tickets API to create custom ticketing experiences for your events.
You need to have at least one existing event before getting started.
### Typical Custom Ticketing Lifecycle
1. In the Dashboard, [create at least one ticket](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-tickets-for-your-event) for an event.
1. Retrieve the ID of an event from the **Events/Events** collection.
1. Retrieve the IDs of event tickets from the **Events/Tickets collection** using the event
ID retrieved above.
1. Get the event `Form` using the [`getForm()`](wix-events.html#getForm)
function with the event ID retrieved above.
1. Retrieve information about the registration form inputs in the form using the [`formData`](wix-events/form/formdata) function.
1. In the Editor, add user input elements for each form input retrieved above.
You may want to set the elements IDs to match the names of form inputs retrieved above
so that you will not have to map the names later.
1. In the Editor, add elements to display the available tickets and add input elements for site visitors to select tickets.
1. In the Editor, add a button that will be used to reserve ticket a site visitor selects.
1. When the reserve button is clicked, gather the selected tickets
and use the [`reserve()`](#reserve) function to reserve the tickets. The function
creates a reservation ID to be used later.
1. In the Editor, add a button that will be used to checkout reserved tickets.
1. When the checkout button is clicked, gather the values entered into the form in
a `FormValue` array and use [`checkout()`](#checkout)
function to checkout the reservation. The function creates an order.
1. Use the payment ID from the order created above to call the Wix Pay API's [`startPayment()`](wix-pay.html#startPayment)
function to complete the payment process.
1. Display the link to the tickets as a PDF.

params.name: eventId
params.doc: ID of the event that the ticket reservations are for.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - Information about the checkout that was performed.

docs.summary: Performs a checkout on reserved tickets.
description: The `checkout()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a
`CheckoutResponse` when the ticket reservation
has been checked out.
To checkout tickets, you must first call the [`reserve()`](#reserve) function
to reserve the tickets.
Use the returned `order` to process payment for the tickets by passing the `order`'s
`paymentId` to the [`startPayment()`](wix-pay.html#startPayment) function. Note that
since the `order` has a `paymentId`, you do not need to first call [`createPayment()`](wix-pay-backend.html#createPayment)
to create a payment.
Before using the startPayment() function, you will need to set up your site to
accept payments. To learn more, see [About Accepting Payments](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-accepting-payments).
When setting up your site to accept payments, be sure to select the payment
methods you want to offer and [set your payment currency](https://support.wix.com/en/article/setting-your-currency-for-accepting-payments).
> **Note:**
To work with the Wix Events API, you need to publish your site.

examples.title: Checkout reserved tickets
body: const eventId = // Get the event ID
let reservationId = // Returned from the reserve() function

examples.title: Reserve, checkout, and update tickets
body: // Retrieve data and set up page
// Verify coupon code when it is entered
// Run a query that will return only one event. Add
// additional filtering to the query if necessary.
// Note that PDF tickets are available before payment is complete
// When a form contains an address, the way you format the
// address information for submission depends on what type
// of input elements you use to gather that information.
// Single element which is not an address
// input element, such as a text input.
// When a form contains an input for adding more guests to an
// RSVP, format the guest names for submission in an array
// where each element is the full name of a guest.

params.name: eventId
params.doc: ID of the event to reserve tickets for.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - Information about the reservations that were created.

docs.summary: Reserves tickets for an event.
description: The `reserve()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a
`ReservationResponse` when the tickets have been reserved.
Retrieve ticket IDs to specify which tickets to reserve from the **Events/Tickets** collection.
> **Note:**
To work with the Wix Events API, you need to publish your site.

// Single element which is not an address
// input element, such as a text input.
// When a form contains an input for adding more guests to an
// RSVP, format the guest names for submission in an array
// where each element is the full name of a guest.

params.doc: ID of the event that the ticket reservations are for.

params.name: orderNumber
params.doc: Number of the order to update.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - Information about the order that was updated.

docs.summary: Updates a ticket order.
description: The `updateOrder()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an
`UpdateOrderResponse` when the ticket order
has been updated with the new form values specified in the `updateInfo` parameter.
You cannot update an order after payment has been processed.
> **Note:**
To work with the Wix Events API, you need to publish your site.

let orderNumber = // Returned from the order() function

params.name: eventId
params.doc: ID of the event that the ticket coupon is for.

params.name: reservationId
params.doc: ID of the reservation that the ticket coupon is for.

params.name: coupon
params.doc: Code of the coupon to verify.

docs.summary: Verifies a ticket coupon.
description: The `verifyCoupon()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an
`VerifyCouponResponse` when the ticket coupon
has been updated.
If the coupon has been verified, the `VerifyCouponResponse` will contain
an `invoice` property with an invoice that includes the coupon discounts.
If the coupon fails verification, the `VerifyCouponResponse` will contain
a `discountErrors` property including information about why the verification
failed.
You may want to call the `verifyCoupon()` function in an input element's
[`onCustomValidation()`]($w.ValidatableMixin.html#onCustomValidation) event
handler to validate a coupon code while the form is being filled out.
> **Note:**
To work with the Wix Events API, you need to publish your site.

let reservationId = // Returned from the reserve() function

members.name: name
members.doc: Fee name. Value is `"WIX_FEE"`: Wix service fee applied to the item.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Fee calculation method.
 One of:

 + `"FEE_ADDED"`: Fee is added to the ticket price at checkout.
 + `"FEE_INCLUDED"`: Seller absorbs the fee. It is deducted from the ticket price.

members.name: rate
members.doc: Rate percentage. Possible values are between `"0.01"` and `"100"`, using up to 2 decimal places.

docs.summary: An object representing a ticket order invoice.

examples.title: Checkout reserved tickets
body: const eventId = // Get the event ID
let reservationId = // Returned from the reserve() function

examples.title: Verify a ticket coupon
body: const eventId = // Get the event ID
let reservationId = // Returned from the reserve() function

members.name: subTotal
members.doc: Invoice subtotal amount before discount, tax, and fees.

members.name: grandTotal
members.doc:
Invoice total amount after discount, tax, and fees.
 Grand total is calculated in the following manner:

 1. Total price of all items in the cart.
 2. Discount is subtracted from the cart (if applicable).
 3. Tax is added (if applicable).
 4. Wix service fee is added.

members.name: revenue
members.doc: Total revenue with taxes, excluding fees. Payment provider fees are not deducted.

members.name: reservationId
members.doc: ID of the reservation used in the order.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: ID of the event the tickets are for.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: ID of the contact associated with the order.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of the member associated with the order.

members.name: firstName
members.doc: First name associated with the order.

members.name: lastName
members.doc: Last name associated with the order.

members.name: fullName
members.doc: Full name associated with the order.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address associated with the order.

members.name: checkoutForm
members.doc: Form values used in the order.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the order.

One of: 

+ `"INITIATED"`
+ `"FREE"`
+ `"PENDING"`
+ `"PAID"`
+ `"OFFLINE_PENDING"`

members.name: ticketQuantity
members.doc: Number of tickets in the order.

members.name: anonymized
members.doc: Indicates whether personal information has been removed.

members.name: fullyCheckedIn
members.doc: Whether all ticket holders in the order have checked in.

members.name: type

 One of:

 A value of `0` means there is no limit.
